6cff4ab8-c380-4aa9-9980-17b6f223d181.en_EN: Components recommended by OpenShift.io to replace license or usage outliers.

a99bf72a-baf4-436e-8095-3955e39d5af0.en_EN: Use areas to organize work items to distinguish between different types or functionalities that are being worked on within a space.

d6c3bc51-f623-4aa4-bea4-4e1d68a27661.en_EN: A backlog is a list of work items that have not been triaged and assigned to a specific iteration.

e8d54bf3-f89e-46e5-86f7-4af6475863b0.en_EN: Defect that causes unexpected behavior in the software.

23c322f1-53b1-4286-b524-37ab58124823.en_EN: Experience describes the envisioned user experience in the product to actualize a parent work item. Each parent work item can have multiple experiences.

dbfc82e1-5a40-44bd-af70-f2dc1a1927a4.en_EN: A feature is a detailed user-story that helps actualize parent experiences. It can support multiple experiences and is generally achievable within a sprint.

5c1b8158-a351-4092-8780-3ad22e1eb173.en_EN: An iteration is used to organize, plan, and execute work items in a certain order. It comprises a logical mix of work items slated to be executed within the time frame of the iteration.

f05a151a-61fa-45b1-8d8b-b3fd7bc63ea9.en_EN: Licenses that conflict at the stack or component level.

3a953b07-0cc3-4b45-b891-bf490216eae3.en_EN: Licenses in your stack that are not commonly used in similar stacks or that rarely go together.

5bd840a6-2f62-4bea-bb04-63252f6ce381.en_EN: Pipelines are a continuous delivery system that, at each step, tests and deploys the code to provide feedback to the user. Examples of such steps are unit testing, performance, integration, and deployment. Each step of the pipeline implements different levels of testing and deployment tasks, provides results, and then passes the code on to the next step.

eb05f2b6-8a3c-4054-b28c-3eb1a47c125f.en_EN: A software development methodology focused on real-world problems, or scenarios, described in the language and from the viewpoint of the user. Scenarios deliver particular value propositions and are realized through experiences.

a5fad1f2-7d5c-4d62-b269-d3637495422a.en_EN: OpenShift.io analyzes the CVEs of all your components and flags components that have security vulnerabilities.

5c543e22-8ae9-4b66-9112-1513d47ab1b4.en_EN: A space is the equivalent of a project. Each iteration and work item must be attached to a space, and a team of people can be attached to a space in various roles. By default, a space contains at least one area and one iteration.

cc2d6cb4-7690-4c02-989c-7d75e3419b7d.en_EN: Work assigned to various team members to implement a feature. They are generally measured in units of 0.5 days, for example, four hours, eight hours, sixteen hours.

203160dd-cb50-4383-a2d6-84efcd472c98.en_EN: Components of your software stack that are not commonly used in similar open source stacks or that rarely go together.

83e52577-cdc4-4687-97d1-86151db74bdc.en_EN: Work item type that states the value provided to the user by addressing a parent work item. Each parent work item can have multiple value propositions.

83e7953e-9335-428c-b1af-7aa4b00cd662.en_EN: Work items describe and keep track of work that needs to be completed. They can be assigned to collaborators within a space. Each work item must be attached to a space and an area (assigned by default). This can be used to model bugs, tasks, features, ideas, and more.

e4c8beb4-1ed1-4275-af20-9ee3cb6dafd1.en_EN: Workspaces are fully configured web-based development environments suitable for your code and runtime needs. They are runtime environments where you can modify, test, debug, or run your code.
